package_explanation: WTG = Wind Turbine Generator (turbine supply). LTSA = Long-Term Service Agreement (multi-year service contract).

commercial.name: headline_price_uplift
example_trades: Reduce uplift in exchange for longer LTSA term
Reduce uplift in exchange for earlier milestone payment

commercial.name: payment_terms
commercial.description: Milestones, retainage, invoice timing; can improve supplier cashflow.
example_trades: Earlier manufacturing start payment in exchange for lower uplift
Reduced payment security in exchange for price decrease

commercial.name: indexation
commercial.description: Price adjustment mechanism tied to an index (inflation/materials).
example_trades: Accept capped indexation instead of higher fixed uplift
Cap/floor + transparency in exchange for lower starting price

schedule.name: manufacturing_slot
schedule.description: Factory reservation and delivery windows. Suppliers may use slot scarcity as leverage.
example_trades: Provide delivery window flexibility in exchange for lower uplift
Commit to earlier technical freeze in exchange for slot confirmation

schedule.name: delay_LDs
schedule.description: LDs = Liquidated Damages. Pre-agreed penalties for delay/performance failures; often capped.
example_trades: Replace LD step-up with capped LD + recovery plan in exchange for price reduction
Lower LD cap in exchange for stronger reporting and recovery commitments

warranty_and_risk.name: warranty_terms
warranty_and_risk.description: Warranty duration, exclusions, and remedy structure (repair/replace/service credit).
example_trades: Extend warranty in exchange for longer LTSA term
Narrow exclusions in exchange for modest uplift

warranty_and_risk.name: liability_cap
warranty_and_risk.description: Maximum liability exposure; often excludes consequential damages.
example_trades: Keep liability cap stable but clarify remedy hierarchy in exchange for lower uplift
Increase cap slightly only if price decreases and exclusions remain standard

service.name: availability_guarantee
service.description: Guaranteed turbine availability (%). Definition and exclusions matter.
example_trades: Improve availability guarantee in exchange for indexed service pricing
Tier service response times in exchange for lower uplift

service.name: service_scope
service.description: Scope of service: spares, response times, condition monitoring, reporting.
example_trades: Bundle spares package in exchange for lower service uplift
Add data access/remote diagnostics rights in exchange for improved terms

glossary.WTG: Wind Turbine Generator: the turbine unit and associated supply scope.
glossary.LTSA: Long-Term Service Agreement: multi-year maintenance/service contract for the turbines.
glossary.LDs: Liquidated Damages: pre-agreed penalties for specific failures (e.g., delay), often capped.
glossary.Availability guarantee: A commitment that turbines are available to generate for a % of time; definition/exclusions matter.
glossary.Indexation: A mechanism to adjust prices based on an agreed index (e.g., inflation/materials), often with a cap/floor.
glossary.Consequential damages: Indirect losses (e.g., lost revenue). Often excluded or limited in contracts.
